description: a(n) = |{m : multiplicative order of n mod m = 3}|.
comments: The multiplicative order of a mod m, gcd(a,m) = 1, is the smallest natural number d for which a^d = 1 (mod m).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = tau(n^3-1)-tau(n-1), where tau(n) = number of divisors of n A000005. Generally, if b(n, r) = |{m : multiplicative order of n mod m = r}| then b(n, r) = Sum_{d|r} mu(d)*tau(n^(r/d)-1), where mu(n) = Moebius function A008683.
crossrefs: Row n=3 of A212957. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 24 2012
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 08 2001
